channel.title: X Cursor
channel.description:
And I mean that literally, as in my cursor turns into an X.
This happens whenever I'm inside of a 3D program, usually after I use a key combination to move around in the viewport. It will stay like that until I reboot the computer (haven't tried other things).
If the cursor changes, like if I highlight text, it will turn into the cursor it's supposed to be, like the I symbol. But whenever it's the normal cursor, it's an X.
Any ideas? Right now I'm in #!, but this has happened with every other distribution I've used as well.

item.description:
@SpeedIsMeh wrote:

[quote=“STH, post:4, topic:386487”]I’ve always had it at the same resolution. The cursor is always fine, unless I open Maya and move around there. Then it’s the default cursor that’s the X. You think it’s a driver issue?

Default for my laptop screen:
1280x800 pixels (338x211 millimeters)

That’s what I’ve always used.

Intel Corporation Mobile 4 Series Chipset Integrated Graphics Controller
Kernel driver in use: i915[/quote]

Can you run glxgears?

Also post contents of /etc/X11/xorg.conf (or your equivalent)
